instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3435 - flickering display
threads.message:
have this 820-3435 that came in with liquid damage, damage close and around SMC, Replaced SMC and damaged parts around, 

Everything worked fine until I booted it up, it has a flickering/ distortion on image, and there is no sound, 

any ideas of what the problem could be, 

thanks in advance!

video:

[url]https://youtu.be/Url3EBnYvRI[/url]

threads.title: 820-3435 - flickering display
threads.message:
It's going into sleep mode so SMC_LID is being pulled low. Probably corrosion on trackpad/connector/flat cable. Could be crap on/under the Hall sensor J6955 too.
All audio is on the IO board, so probably bad IO board and/or flat cable.
